constraints_details.constraints_layer_description: CILRES CIL ZONE: Higher Rate - RATE: £120 per square metre

decision_conditions: The development to which this permission relates must be begun not later than the expiration of three years beginning with the date of the decision notice. Reason: To comply with the provisions of S.51 of the Planning & Compulsory Purchase Act 2004.

The development hereby permitted shall be carried out in accordance with the following approved plans: Location Plan PROPOSED BLOCK PLAN 2406-103EXISTING AND PROPOSED ELEVATIONS AND SECTIONS  2406-105PROPOSED FLOOR PLANS 2406-106 Rev AEnergy Statement NARCH DESIGN AND BUILD Date July 2024Reason: For the avoidance of doubt and in the interests of proper planning.

Prior to the completion of the change of use, details of the proposed living roof and ecological enhancements, as outlined within the NARCH DESIGN AND BUILD Energy Statement Dated July 2024 shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority.  The development shall be completed in accordance with the approved details.Reason: In the interests of enhancing biodiversity and sustainable drainage.

Prior to first occupation, details of the internal consumption of potable water shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority.  Submitted details will demonstrate reduced water consumption through the use of water efficient fittings, appliances and recycling systems to show consumption equal to or less than 105 litres per person per day.  The development shall be carried out strictly in accordance with the details so approved and maintained as such thereafter.Reason: To promote water conservation and efficiency measures in all new developments and where possible in the retrofitting of existing stock in accordance with Policy CP21 of the Core Strategy, Policy 5.15 of the London Plan.

Prior to first occupation, a detailed Energy Statement shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. Submitted details will demonstrate the maximum achievable energy efficiency achievable for the development and shall provide for the maximum achievable improvements in the total CO2 emissions arising from the operation of a development and its services over part L of Building Regs 2013. The Energy Statement should outline how the reductions are achieved through the use of Fabric Energy Efficiency performance, energy efficient fittings, and the use of renewable technologies in line with Policy DMD49, the CO2 savings of the proposal shall not be less than 35%. The development shall be implemented in accordance with the approved details and maintained as such thereafter. Reason: In the interest of sustainable development and to ensure that the Local Planning Authority may be satisfied that CO2 emission reduction targets are met in accordance with Policy CP20 of the Enfield Core Strategy (2010), Policies DMD49, DMD50 and DMD51 of the Enfield Development Management Document (2014).

Following practical completion of works a final Energy Performance Certificate with accompanying Building Regulations compliance report shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. Where applicable, a Display Energy Certificate shall be submitted within 18 months following first occupation. Reason: In the interest of sustainable development and to ensure that the Local Planning Authority may be satisfied that CO2 emission reduction targets are met in accordance with Policy CP20 of the Enfield Core Strategy (2010), Policies DMD49, DMD50 and DMD51 of the Enfield Development Management Document (2014).

Prior to first occupation, details of the design of refuse storage facilities including facilities for the recycling of waste to satisfy the future number of occupiers on site, shall be provided within the development, in accordance with the London Borough of Enfield - Waste and Recycling Planning Storage Guidance ENV 08/162. The development shall be implemented in accordance with the approved details and maintained as such thereafter. Reason: In order to facilitate efficient, safe and clean removal of household refuse, the location and accessibility of refuse storage plus to maintain safety on the Highway.

Prior to first occupation of the development, the cycle storage shown on the approved drawings must be provided on site and maintained as such thereafter. Unless otherwise agreed, the cycle parking should be provided in compliance with the following criteria:oProvision of a minimum of TWO long stay cycle parking spaces for each flato secured: with a British Standard mortice lock or access fobo fully enclosed: 4 walls and a roofReason: In the interests of promoting healthy and sustainable transport.

The site shall be enclosed in accordance with details to be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. The means of enclosure shall be erected in accordance with the approved detail before the development is occupied.Reason: To ensure that the amenity space provided for future occupiers is of a satisfactory standard and appearance and to safeguard the privacy, amenity and safety of adjoining occupiers.

The development must maintain the compensated family dwelling in the proposed layout, ensuring that the new units provide adequate living space and amenities suitable for family use in accordance with the approved details before the development is occupied or use commences and be maintained as such thereafter. Reason: To accord with Policies DMD5 of the Development Management Document 2014 and CP5 of the Core Strategy 2010, which seek to preserve family housing.

The proposal must maintain the garden area in the rear, providing adequate private amenity space for the new units. in accordance with the approved details before the development is occupied or use commences and maintained as such thereafter.Reason: To ensure that the development provides functional outdoor spaces for residents, in accordance with Policy DMD9 of Development Management Document 2014.
description: Change of use from single family dwelling into two self-contained flats.
